]]> By: Jo Diggity http://codebetter.com/jeremymiller/2005/04/26/long-methods-and-classes-are-evil/#comment-3 Jo Diggity Sun, 10 Aug 2008 09:16:37 +0000 /blogs/jeremy.miller/archive/2005/04/26/129549.aspx#comment-3 I don't buy your less than 10 public methods. A class should be an organised unit of abstracted code that serves a single purpose. Sometimes this includes having dozens of methods. Your logic would mean that classes would be limited in functionality. Perhaps you don't understand OOP? I don’t buy your less than 10 public methods.
